website_summaries.verdict: This set of 3 grip and hand-strengthening balls doubles as stress balls and looks at home on any desk or workspace.
pros: Each ball offers a different level of resistance
Use for hand strength or to relieve tension as a stress ball
Thermoplastic rubber for easy, grippy feel
cons: Not intended for children under 5, as they could be put into the mouth
Lint, hair, and other debris can stick to the rubbery-feeling balls

customer_reviews.title: So glad to have!
customer_reviews.text: Very glad to have these to help open my finger joints, especially in the morning when a few are painfully locked up after sleep. While watching TV I squeeze away and because they are squishy I end up not noticing that I have exercised both hands for some time! I'm hoping that in time they will have made a difference in my diminishing hand strength. Package comes with 3 Eggs of various firmness. Delivery was prompt. I'm happy with this product and seller :)
customer_reviews.author: HMG

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my daughter who is almost 4 her teachers suggested a stress ball to help improve her strength in her hands and arms and I found these.... love the fact that this company has different sizes and each set has different firmness .. these were the perfect size for her little hands and she doing well using them... photos included compares a child’s hand and an adults hand
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Heymann

customer_reviews.title: Everything sticks to them!
customer_reviews.text: For someone who is OCD like myself these balls are not the best as everything sticks to it. There will be so much lint on these balls by the end of the day which makes me not want to carry them around or take outside the house and when im home I do not use them as often as I should. Texture of this product needs to worked on.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A Must for anyone who uses a Computer Keyboard or Precision Tools!!
customer_reviews.text: Do you have an Office Job sitting behind a Computer Keyboard all day? Well, what are you waiting for? Get these Exercise Balls and get the life back into your hands and fingers and wrist. I think every keyboard or computer must come with one to avoid wrist injury and keep your hands healthy and strong. On the other hand, I can now open bottles and Jars mush easier, even splitting my medication pills is easy now, before I was using a pill splitting gadget, not anymore!. Playing the piano, more control over my fingers, holding the rope to the boat, tools. I’m still using the Yellow Ball and building my strength slowly, but the results are magnificent.
customer_reviews.author: Busy Bee

customer_reviews.title: Great eggs
customer_reviews.text: I was a little apprehensive about these. I figured they would be just like stress balls but I was very wrong. It’s tough to describe but these work very different. I bought them to help with tendinitis in my wrist. They are just the right amount of resistance and can be used in a variety of ways. They also seem like they will hold up over time. Very happy with these eggs.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: The Perfect Hand Therapy Device for Arthritis
customer_reviews.text: First of all, I'm a sufferer of psoriatic arthritis, and that's why I was looking for some kind of hand exerciser. So I chose pretty much at random, these egg-shaped squeezy balls that come in a set of three. Upon opening the box I detected each egg had a progressive resistance (soft, medium and firm). I began using them immediately to restore flexibility to my finger joints. The egg shape I found was perfect because I can change the contour to a curve that best fits the finger joint that needs work. I guess it was dumb luck, but I found the perfect hand therapy device! Thanks Friendly Swede!
customer_reviews.author: Gary Olsen

customer_reviews.title: Easy to grip. Won’t slip.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the 3 color set in Large. I bought these to combat wrist issues from prolongued computer use and improve grip strength for indoor rock climbing. The softest “egg” is quite squishy and readily manipulated. Best for between the finger and weaker, outer finger exercises. The medium and hardest eggs have significant steps up in stiffness. They are all solid gel or gel-like rubber. They do bounce. They are lightly textured. Between the texture and the almost sticky-like nature of the material, you will not have to worry about them slipping around. They are great for idle hand exercises while in a meeting, on the phone, reading, computing, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: I love squeezing my balls.
customer_reviews.text: As a writer who spends hours each day pounding on keyboards x many years at it, I have developed arthritis in several fingers. I also have occasional wrist pain. Squeezing these has helped work the fingers and keep them more limber I started with the softest one several weeks ago. I think in a few more I will go up to the next hardest for more resistance.
customer_reviews.author: Spalding W. Coyote

customer_reviews.title: Good focus for stress.
customer_reviews.text: My son is having trouble with bullying in school. It's enough to give him stress, but not bad enough where the school thinks it's just kids being kids. He said the stress egg has helped him focus his stress so he doesn't bite his nails or pick. I recommend them. The yellow color of the smaller egg makes it less noticeable to the other kids.
customer_reviews.author: JENNY LORENSEN

customer_reviews.title: This shape makes the difference.
customer_reviews.text: I really liked the egg shape design of these which is why I ordered this model. If you have sore fingers the narrow top helps you exercise just the right spot on your fingers rather than using your whole hand. The three strength sizes are are well balanced for rehab all the way up to stress relief allowing you to complete many different exercises. The detailed exercise diagram was a nice touch as well. I do recommend ordering the middle size however. I have large hands and the biggest size is too large to fit between your fingers and palm comfortably. I ordered a set of the middle size and kept the big size as a back up.
customer_reviews.author: Bongo

customer_reviews.title: Easy To Use, Effective Hand Exerciser
customer_reviews.text: These eggs really work. They provide me a convenient and easy way to exercise and strengthen my hands, and relieve stress. They show no sign of deteriorating, getting sticky, etc. over time. And, as an added bonus, they even look attractive if I forget and leave them out on a table or bookcase (especially around Easter)! Earlier this year I had a case of "trigger finger" (tendons in one finger somehow binding, causing the finger to lock in place and not open readily) Using the eggs seems to have helped that condition go away. If you are looking for a simple yet effective way to exercise your hands, this product is definitely worth buying.
customer_reviews.author: JTL III

customer_reviews.title: Great for Sensory Overload
customer_reviews.text: My high functioning autistic child is 7 years old and is getting really stressed, anxious and frustrated having to have class online during this Covide-19 era. So his behavior specialist and I thought giving him something to do that is not all that appealing (fidget spinners are too distracting) would help him with his meltdowns and emotions he is going through. He currently uses the yellow because it's the softest but still firm. Pink is medium firmness and blue is firmest. These are wonderful and I have noticed him able to adjust with the times a bit better while having this stress in his grips. I personally use his blue.
customer_reviews.author: Christi

customer_reviews.title: These are great. They don't pick up lint
customer_reviews.text: Getting older. Hands getting weaker, without targeted exercise. Purchased these to offset finger-joint pain, and to stay limber for crocheting. These are great. They don't pick up lint, dust, or hair, and are not sticky feeling. No nasty plastic odor. Fit perfectly in the hand. Graduated resistances. Portable anywhere. I exercise my hands with these in a bowl of very warm water. It's very soothing and stress relieving. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Arasellen

customer_reviews.title: The Egg Shape Fits Perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: Afraid they'd be too small i.e. a female who inherited her dad's hands & not my mom's tiny ones, but they're the right size for trying to strengthen my osteoarthritis plagued paws. Getting old sure ain't for sissies. Still wear a pair of calf leather gloves from Saks...size 7 1/2. Maybe that'll help someone to gauge the size. Told to do this ball thing by my doctor...figured it couldn't hurt. It rather does, but I'm hoping it'll help eventually...
customer_reviews.author: Kandy Langford

customer_reviews.title: Love the feel and color of the eggs - my ...
customer_reviews.text: Love the feel and color of the eggs - my favorite is the blue one. I had made a suggestion before but will also repeat it here. Perhaps include 3 mesh bags in the appropriate color to allow each each to be held by a string and keep it from accidentally rolling away. I have put my blue one in a blue mesh eyeglass mesh bag and have added a blue cord with enough room to keep the egg on my wrist, which allows me to type on a computer without putting it down, and to keep it from accidentally rolling away. If you ever do this let me know and I will purchase it. Thanks, Dana
customer_reviews.author: DC Mack

customer_reviews.title: does what you would expect, sticky feeling at first
customer_reviews.text: nothing too fancy about these, but they get the job done. They seem to be good quality and feel fine in your hand. The different densities are nice to choose between. Only complaint is that they feel really sticky/gooey when you first get them. Once you use them a few days, I guess your dead skin sticks to them or the goo gets rubbed of and they feel fine. Don't drop them into a pile of dust or hair until then, or you'll have it stuck all over them.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Great for child anxiety.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my son who has 6 diagnoses including anxiety which I noticed was flaring up at his flag football games. He would pick and bite all the skin around his nails so bad he was not even paying attention to the game. Once I used the egg as a redirection tool and told him to squeeze the egg instead, he finally stopped shredding his fingers. Amazing item.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: These are - in no way - "stress" balls
customer_reviews.text: These cause more stress than they relieve it. All three are too hard, and although I know they are billed as strength trainers, it should NOT be marketed as any kind of stress ball. All five of us agree - these cause stress.
customer_reviews.author: A Wife, Mom, JediTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: too hard.
customer_reviews.text: It's nothing you can explain in a product discription or a picture, but the hard grips are harder than I expected. I was expecting something more along the lines of silly putty or a water balloon or just something more mushy. These grips have the firmness of something like an orange.
customer_reviews.author: digitalbill

customer_reviews.title: Love the Egg Shape, Size & Texture
customer_reviews.text: More durable & flexible than the Gripp II hand exercise balls I've used to help strengthen & combat arthritis in my hands. I wear a men's medium cadet golf glove & found the small size the best fit for me. In my palm, I can squeeze most flexible yellow grip to the point of my finger tips touching my thumb pad. The yellow grip is perfect for between the finger exercise. The red grip is medium & blue is more firm. The egg shape with dimpled texture have a great feel & the surface is easily cleaned with mild soap & water.
customer_reviews.author: Stanley F.

customer_reviews.title: He also has poor hand strength despite being a very active young man
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for my son. He needs something in his hands most of the time to help him focus on what he needs to learn. He also has poor hand strength despite being a very active young man. We have only had them for a few days but he really is enjoying them. He started with the yellow, and has decided that that one is almost too soft for him, but enjoys the feel of it anyway. The blue one is the one he likes to show his "strength" on. Great product that holds up to an active child!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Finger and Hand Workout.
customer_reviews.text: I really like these balls as I have some arthritis and I was looking for something to increase my finger range of motion and these work great. I bought 3 sets, one of each size and I love them. My fingers are more flexible and they are easy to use, the only thing I have to remember is to stop using them. I once watched a TV show and exercised for an hour, the next day my hands were a bit sore but that was my fault. If you have any problems with hand strength or finger mobility I highly recommend these balls.
customer_reviews.author: Poe Fan

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, fun, and effective
customer_reviews.text: I got these to combat incipient arthritis and love them. They are so comfortable and enticingly squishy - they make you want to use them. They definitely have a "fun factor" rather than seeming like an exercise slog. I have medium-sized woman's hands and got the large; like the full grip exercise this provides. They are durable, easily washable, and attractive. I replaced another spring hand-grip with these and vastly prefer them for the better fit to hand/fingers. Couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: S. Birks

customer_reviews.title: Beware of Size and Resistance
customer_reviews.text: Good quality product which is why I rated 4 stars. I am a man that wears XL or XXL gloves and the large size fits my hand but someone with smaller hands would have trouble. Not a problem just order the proper size for you. The resistance is more than I expected. I will be using the soft or medium until I build up my strength. Having too much is probably better than not enough and who knows it might soften up with use. Overall a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Big Chill

customer_reviews.title: They fit perfectly in your hand and they have three different densities.
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing. My fiance has a broken finger and needed stress balls for therapy. Those are just filled with beads and squishable, so we weren't thrilled with how those were working out. These eggs fit his hands perfectly have different densities to allow for different pressures. They don't slip out of his hand and they fit perfectly in the palm. My son is now using them to keep his fingers limber for football. I definitely recommend these over stress balls and this particular brand is the answer to the physical therapy issue.
customer_reviews.author: JoAnna

customer_reviews.title: Good for strengthening
customer_reviews.text: Great exercising help. (They don’t melt and stick to clothes, finger nails and more if you fall asleep while using, like exercise dough. Yes, I did that.) The 5 exercise pictures are good, no text needed. The smaller size is fine for me. I HOPE the larger size I got for a man are big enough. (Some reviews have mentioned wishing they were larger. Maybe a third size is needed too?) I’m looking forward to working up from the least resistance as I get stronger. Thanks Friendly Swede!
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Good tool for hand therapy
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for hand therapy at the advice of my therapist, these do the job well. I have only used the orange (low resistance and am just starting the mid-range resistance ball/egg. I have arthritis at the base of my thumb, and while I don't think these will alter that, I have already noted (in conjunction with therapy and other tools) improvement in my grip strength, which had drastically declined.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Ripley-Duggan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for Carpel Tunnel and for Lab Work
customer_reviews.text: Finally a product that works for my small hands. I use them to stretch my wrists and fingers multiple times a day. It just takes a few seconds. I have one at work, and 2 at home. I also took one for my lab draw and held it in my hand so my small veins immediately came up. If you have small veins and need a butterfly needle for a blood draw this is perfect. Would recommend for children that need lab work. I am placing my second order. Will keep a ball every where including my purse.
customer_reviews.author: Ambriel

customer_reviews.title: very soft like a big chunk of gummy bears...and just as sticky!
customer_reviews.text: These hand therapy ball/eggs are very soft like a big chunk of gummy bears. And as others have noted, they are just as sticky as gummy bears too (see pics). I'm using these "gummy bears" to rehab my hand that I injured lifting weights and they feel like they would do the job fairly well. But the stickiness can be problematic. I haven't dropped the gummy bears on the carpet yet but if I do, I'm sure I will see a disgusting gummy and hairy bear! The stickiness doesn't seem to stay on your hands though so they're fine for their intended purpose, just don't drop them!
customer_reviews.author: Wingsdomain Art and Photography

customer_reviews.title: How do we buy a couple more of only the pale yellow stress ball?
customer_reviews.text: I really, really like these stress/exercise balls, but especially one in particular. I'd really like to be able to order 2 or 3 of whichever colour(s) I prefer. Ever since they arrived several months ago, I've used the "yellow," softest, stress ball. (I think the colour is more "off-white," or very pale yellow.) I don't require it for any type of rehab. It just feels good and squishy, and is such an easy, pleasant and physical way to relieve stress. For me, the bonus is that it also strengthens hands and fingers as excellent grip-strength cross-training for kettlebells, climbing, etc.! I'm squeezing it right now! May we order a few more of the same?
customer_reviews.author: Marian

customer_reviews.title: Great hand strengthener!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these hoping to reduce trigger thumb pain and tightness. After just several minutes using the softest yellow egg, my thumb feels more relaxed. They are about the size of an extra large egg, and the shape fits perfect in your hand, verses a round ball. They are slightly textured so they don't slip away, and the texture reminds me of a firm gum drop or firm Jell-O eggs. I will stay with the yellow egg and eventually work up to the firmer colors. I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly M.

customer_reviews.title: Extra small is perfect for my hand
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the extra small. They are the perfect size for my hand. I like the durability. It’s a much more durable stress ball, with varying firmness. They do have a slightly tacky feeling, but I’m guessing that will wear off. I like them, and I would purchase them again.
customer_reviews.author: SG

customer_reviews.title: fast delivery, excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Our physical therapist recommended this type of item for my Dad's hand therapy after neck surgery; they arrived promptly and were exactly what we wanted. The different strengths seem to be well-spaced, they are easy for him to hold onto even though he does not have normal sensation in his hands, and the easy one (after Dad had moved on) felt so 'nice' to my Mom's arthritic hands that she took up squeezing it for fun, doing her some good also.
customer_reviews.author: C. Miller

customer_reviews.title: A squeeze here builds muscle there
customer_reviews.text: Liked that the product is soft enough to allow exercises but firm enough to provide the resistance needed to work the muscles in the hand and forearms. Got the large and they fell a little big but I think that the small may have been to small to fit in the hand and work comfortably. Had reverse shoulder replacement surgery and making a fist as well as flexing the arm were prescribed exercises to do at home before formal physical therapy started. This product really has helped and highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: WCE

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: These eggs are well made and sturdy. I had an open heart surgery 4 weeks ago and they nicked a nerve on my right hand putting the artery catheter in and so I have 2 numb fingers on my right hand. The feelings will return after a while but my surgeon recommends an exercise ball to strengthen the fingers. It comes in 3 with different strengths each. I am using the softest one which is the yellow about 4-5 times a day. I’m very pleased with them and hope to slowly graduate to the strongest egg in time. I highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Maria M.

customer_reviews.title: Good but kinda sticky?
customer_reviews.text: I liked the egg shape as it was easier to handle than an all round one. Bought these for my dad to help strengthen his grip after being in the hospital over a month. He enjoyed them, the only reason for 4 stars was that they did have a semi sticky feeling to them.
customer_reviews.author: Nitsuj Regnilsna

customer_reviews.title: Really helps with stiff/sore hands and fingers
customer_reviews.text: These really helped alleviate the stiffness and soreness in my fingers. They are well made and have a nice texture so they don't feel sticky or tacky. Having three different balls with varying resistance is nice, too. Size small is about the size of a normal chicken egg and is a good fit for my small hands (I usually wear size small women's gloves). They are a bit too small for my husband to use, so for men or anyone with larger hands I'd recommend the large size. Very pleased with these!
customer_reviews.author: Kitty

customer_reviews.title: Great for recovering from arm surgery!
customer_reviews.text: My wife recently has had two surgeries for a badly fractured elbow. As a result of nerve impingement, her muscles were quite wasted after two months. Once the nerve entrapment was released, she has been given the go ahead to strart strengthening all the arm and hand muscles. She's incredibly happy with these eggs!
customer_reviews.author: John Adams

customer_reviews.title: Rehab's My Goal
customer_reviews.text: I like the eggs. I am trying to recover my thumb strength which has severely diminished. I believe these "squishers" will help a great deal. Still too soon to tell. Might also work as a tension reliever for others, but that's not my interest.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: The staffers were GREAT! They were very help full
customer_reviews.text: Dear Sirs, The staffers were GREAT! They were very help full. Inicialy I bought the eggs for my wife who has problems with her hands. By using these balls 2 and 3 times a day, her hands became more flexible. She has one ball at work,another one,when she travels, finally another at home. Thanks for your products. I will buy again. Vincent Garcia
customer_reviews.author: Vincent S. Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful
customer_reviews.text: These are a great size, especially for finger exercises. I had recently purchased the small eggs, which are also nice, for palm and thumb index. I had thumbCarpal release joint replacement/ surgery a few months ago, And find all of these very helpful to increase mobility, alleviate stiffness and, of course 😉 entertain my grand daughters. I find them very helpful and seem to be of good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Lorilou208

customer_reviews.title: Good for hand/grip exercises
customer_reviews.text: These are good at-home physical therapy/stress relief balls. I like how they come in three different levels of firmness, and their shape and size makes them easy to hold in hand. I bought these originally because I've been having elbow pain, and hand therapy can help relieve those kinds of aches (I think they've helped a little in this regard), but I've liked how they've strengthened my grip, too.
customer_reviews.author: MC

customer_reviews.title: and shape are great for helping focus attention and/or calming any frayed nerves ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for my child--who loves them! Their texture, weight, and shape are great for helping focus attention and/or calming any frayed nerves as they can be squeezed and/or tossed. The three levels of density are also good for variety as my child is really tuned into such differences. They're more durable than other items I have purchased for identical purposes. I definitely recommend them to other parents.
customer_reviews.author: consumer

customer_reviews.title: 5 STARS
customer_reviews.text: AMENDED REVIEW, I MADE AN ERROR ORIGINALLY GIVING THE PRODUCT TWO STARS IT WAS ME THAT SHOULD HAVE RECEIVED TWO STARTS DO TO MY NOT READING THE DESCRIPTION THOROUGHLY THE PRODUCT IS EXACTLY AS DESCRIBED AND EXTREMELY WELL MADE. THE VENDOR WENT ABOVE AND BEYOND BY CONTACTING ME AND SUPPLYING THE SET I SHOULD HAVE ORDERED THE FIRST TIME. GREAT, GREAT, GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!
customer_reviews.author: R.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product!
customer_reviews.text: I love the egg shape stress eggs! I bought it for my dad because he had stroke and I want him to get his strength back. I also use it to just keep my hands busy squeezing the eggs shape and it’s fun. I bought a size small because I’m 5’2 and that’s what the reviews recommended getting and it works out perfectly. Although it may be too small for my dad but at least it’s something for him to do to keep his hand busy. It’s a really good items and good quality! I love The Friendly Swede products!
customer_reviews.author: Kay Apple

customer_reviews.title: Great comfortable relaxing to squeeze
customer_reviews.text: I donate plasma on a regular basis. They use to provide squeeze tubes for donaters but quit as they deemed them unsanitary. These squeeze eggs are a perfect substitute and though may be an unconventional un-planned utilization for them ..squeezing one during the plasma donating process is comfortable, relaxing and helps everything flow smoothly.
customer_reviews.author: kbnet56

customer_reviews.title: More Than a Stress Ball
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves his set of three Friendly Swede Hand Grip Strength Trainers. He keeps one in the kitchen, one in the office and one by the bed. They are the perfect size and shape for his hands. Normal stress balls are squishy with little resistance, like a novelty toy. These are more solid and provide a satisfying amount of resistance for his fidgety hands and fingers. And they are odorless!
customer_reviews.author: shopgirl

customer_reviews.title: Great hand exerciser
customer_reviews.text: These stress balls did not disappoint. They are exactly as described and perfect for my hand therapy. I have been using these for about 3 weeks and find that my hand strength is increasing. I keep the easiest one at my desk, the next one in my car (I squeeze at the red lights), and the hardest one in my purse. This way I can complete my therapy of 20 squeezes every hour. The egg shape is also much more comfortable than a round shape.
customer_reviews.author: Murphy Lily

customer_reviews.title: Eh
customer_reviews.text: Cheap ! Ones already misshapen from just sitting on its side. As for size it’s good as for quality needs to be re examined! The denser one is good the mid grade and softer grade need to be upped a little
customer_reviews.author: Mark DeVoe

customer_reviews.title: Love these!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these together back the strength in my left hand.I had a nerve block in my left shoulder during shoulder surgery. The block made the grip weaker in my left hand. These are great to use to build up the strength in my hand.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Hollister

customer_reviews.title: Really worked for me!
customer_reviews.text: I broke my wrist in 2 places several months ago. I did PT after the cast was removed, but my wrist still felt very stiff, and ached a lot after that. I bought these stress balls hoping that using them would make my wrist feel better. They really have helped. I started out using the softest one, and after a while worked my way up to the harder ones. I don’t use them regularly anymore, but I keep one on my nightstand and use it occasionally. My wrist is much better, no stiffness.
customer_reviews.author: Claudia C.

customer_reviews.title: Much smaller than you think
customer_reviews.text: I paid how much for a small glop? This company counts on people not returning these things. Maybe $0.50 of plastic molded to be a little bigger than a robin's egg.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph R

customer_reviews.title: "Handy" little eggs... get it? Handy :-)
customer_reviews.text: Love these little eggs! My son doesn't like the physical act of writing, so I bought these to help build up his hand muscles. He likes using them and they are easy to clean. I find that I end up using them too. I'm a nurse and the exercises feel good and help keep my dexterity intact. I appreciate that there were three levels of difficulty. Had I just bought the hard one, I might not have been as pleased. I definitely can tell a difference after using the yellow for a while and have started working my way up. My son's stamina for writing seems to be improving as well.
customer_reviews.author: EastsideGirl

customer_reviews.title: Weird texture
customer_reviews.text: Returned these. The texture of the item was really uncomfortable- probably a combination of sticky and slimy. I didn't enjoy holding it for even a minute. My boyfriend held these as well and said, " Yuck, I don't like how that feels." However, they arrived quickly, and the return was processed quickly, so there's that.
customer_reviews.author: Jennily D.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty basic
customer_reviews.text: I got these to try and get my hands warmed up for rock climbing on my way to the gym. It does an ok job, but it doesnt get a range of motion for full tendon and hand strength. Overall cheap and durable. Not what im looking for in the product but still will use since I have them. Side notes: dont drop them on a dirty floor since they will pick up any debris and they have a odor but that went away within the first few days.
customer_reviews.author: Username86

customer_reviews.title: Very clever design
customer_reviews.text: Very clever design. You'd think that a squeeze-ball would be good enough but the tapered shape of these offer different resistance based on how you grip &/or hold them in your hand. The different resistances are so that you can clearly feel a difference between each of the colors. I am a very happy customer! Considering buying a 2nd set to keep at my desk at work.
customer_reviews.author: 311IO7

customer_reviews.title: shape is great, pressure is ok
customer_reviews.text: shape is great, pressure is ok.. accidentally I left one of the eggs over a sheet of paper in the office, and it left an oily spot on the sheet, so wtf is that anyways, my hands are not oily after using, so there is that. also, they seem to gather too much dirt on them, I have to constantly wipe them or else its kinda gross all this sounds bad, and it is, but the product is great nonetheless and I give 4 stars, comfy and it works as advertised
customer_reviews.author: VENANCIA GOMEZ N.

customer_reviews.title: Great for arthritis!
customer_reviews.text: I have arthritis in both hands. These have worked wonders for me. I use them while at work and at home when reading or watching TV. I have use them for a Couple of months now and I can seriously feel less pain in my hands. I believe I use these more than any other product because the are soft to touch.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly

customer_reviews.title: I like these a lot
customer_reviews.text: I like these a lot. I wanted to work on strengthening my grip and had trouble deciding between these egg shaped ones and the traditional ball shaped ones. Ultimately I am glad I stuck with the egg shaped ones. The traditional ball shaped ones have always been fairly difficult for me to use, they feel a bit awkward to squeeze. These seem smaller, but that simply could be because their mass is in a different shape. This shape is easier for me to hold and squeeze. Someone with large hands may find them too small though.
customer_reviews.author: Jet

customer_reviews.title: Great for Hand Exercises
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect for exercising my fingers while watching TV in the evening or while taking a break at my desk. Starting out with the least firm (green) and gradually working my way up to the firmest (dark blue). I ordered the large. I don't have large hands, but they fit my hand well for my purpose. I have a smaller one from a year or so ago, and now that I have a chance to compare, I prefer the larger ones.
customer_reviews.author: jane

customer_reviews.title: Nice Eggs
customer_reviews.text: I really like these. I play, er, exercise with them all the time. The black one is very stiff, and great for getting out frustrations after a particularly difficult day of work. The orange one is nice and squishy, and is good for absentmindedly squeezing whilst watching tv. The green one is somewhere in between. I haven't seen it in a couple of days. I hope the dog didn't eat it. Time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: P. J. Sauter

customer_reviews.title: Great tactile toy!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for my classroom to help kids remain focused during teaching. They are large enough that if children do place in their mouths they will be unable to swallow and choke on them (that is a concern for some kids at times). The colors are bright and engaging. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Dominic T. Sedillo

customer_reviews.title: I  whole-heartedly recommend them.
customer_reviews.text: I have arthritis in both hands which is painful at times. Recently, I've noticed my grip failing and I've been dropping stuff. I think these cute little eggs will do the trick for me. It's only been a few days and already my hands feel stronger. They are perfect to keep bye my easy-chair. Hand grip strength training is painless with these. I whole-heartedly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: EOS

customer_reviews.title: He played with these fun little eggs and shortly was exclaiming how he could ...
customer_reviews.text: I got these for a friend who had a small stroke and is left with a weaker left side. His grip had been so much less than before that he needed help (for example) with opening a ziplock bag. He couldn't bring his fingers into his palm very far either. He played with these fun little eggs and shortly was exclaiming how he could move his fingers over his palm and move finger by finger again! This was after one time of playing. It was amazing to see the joy and hope he got from just that night. I highly recommend these for anyone...to improve grip, motion in a stiff hand, or simply enjoys playing with these balls.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Deller

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I am so glad I searched the site until I found these! I am an older female whose hands are average sized. These smaller, egg shaped balls fit perfectly in my hand but give me plenty of room to squeeze with my whole hand and fingers. I bought 2 sets so I'd have the same strength for both hands and I'm glad I did.
customer_reviews.author: Jo

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Broke my wrist.. Had surgery one weeks ago.. Started with extra small...(soft) Now using the small (soft) ....orthopedic surgeon told me.. "Move those fingers around.. Or they will stiffen up.." and thats what was happening.. Until I started using these 4 days after surgery.. Glad I bought them..
customer_reviews.author: Jaybird

customer_reviews.title: Best I've found
customer_reviews.text: These are the third type of hand grip balls I've used and after a week of use I'd say they are the best so far. The ones filled with (sand/birdseed/?) wear out in months and 'pop'. There was another that started with a tacky feel and this only got worse over time. Having these come in three firmness levels means you can use different ones for different exercises, or different people. So far I'm very satisfied with these.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Thomas

customer_reviews.title: YES!
customer_reviews.text: These have been great for helping my hands especially after knitting! My husband bogarted the green/med firm one and he says he loves it and has gotten a lot of use out of it at the office. I like that they are egg shaped. I'm also really happy that I went with the large size as I have really long slender fingers and the large are the perfect size for me.
customer_reviews.author: Heaven Leigh

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for something small enough to hold comfortably and squeeze while donating blood that wasn't too firm, and these worked perfectly! I like using the yellow one. It has an almost sticky feel that makes it easier to not drop while holding. Also easy to clean with soap and water.
customer_reviews.author: Anita Mascarenhas

customer_reviews.title: I feel like these are a bit too tough to squeeze but ...
customer_reviews.text: These are being used by my autism spectrum child (7) to help him learn how to self manage his anger/attitude. He is used to using a sand-filled ballon. I feel like these are a bit too tough to squeeze but he has fallen in love with them. He actually decided to give the softest (yellow) to his sister as a means to not leave her out of the new 'toy'.
customer_reviews.author: Raphael Alfred

customer_reviews.title: Very nice product
customer_reviews.text: My grandson said he wanted stress relief balls so I put these in his Christmas stocking. He's 12 and they fit his hand with just the right resistance. He took 2 home and left 1 at my house. Unfortunately puppy destroyed the one here, but I am so glad they came 3 to a box. These are really very nice and a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: J. PIERCE

customer_reviews.title: A must have for weight lifters.
customer_reviews.text: I'm kind of in a unique situation. I lift weights 4 times per week , I also play piano every day. After I lift weights my fingers and hands can be stiff and inflexible, I bought these hoping they would loosen up my hands after a weight lifting session, and they do exactly that. I have recommended these to other weight lifters because of how effective they are. I would definitely purchase these again, in fact, I'm wondering how I got by without them up until this point.
customer_reviews.author: John F.

customer_reviews.title: Very usable
customer_reviews.text: I'm pleased with this product in simple terms because of its usability. Many times therapy tools are too resistant to be used by someone who has actually lost strength, so the fact that the easy egg was very usable made it worth the price. I'm in my 2nd week and almost ready to move to the 2nd ball, which I have already tested and found to be useable, yet resistant enough to be useful. A really good solution if you have lost strength in your hands and/or forearms.
customer_reviews.author: ginny hines

customer_reviews.title: The hand grip balls are ideal to aid one in relieving stress.
customer_reviews.text: I keep the stress relieving balls on the dining table and inevitably someone in our family will reach and grab one to start squeezing while carrying on conversation. The dinner table is an ideal place because everyone enjoys getting together for a meal, and during the sometimes excitable conversations, one or two members will reach for a ball to relieve good and bad anxiety or anxiousness. Good product. The balls are not only an interesting conversation item, but also relieve tensions
customer_reviews.author: William J Romero

customer_reviews.title: Great for rehab
customer_reviews.text: Wife had carpel tunnel release on her wrist and has been using these. She has small hands and the small size worked great for her. She likes the egg shape and the doctor is happy with her rehab work. 3 different strengths, she just uses the softest ones but did compare them.
customer_reviews.author: David M.

customer_reviews.title: Good Stuff
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these for rehab after shoulder surgery and they are exactly what I was hoping. They feel very nice in your hands so work just as well for stress relief as they do for hand and finger exercises. Only one minor issue which doesn't really bother me (see five stars above). They are a little tacky, as in texture, so if you drop them they'll likely pick up some dirt/hair/lint. They're easy to wash off though so like I said not really a bother.
customer_reviews.author: Matt H

customer_reviews.title: These work!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a set of these for my 84-year-old mother who was having trouble grasping objects, writing, and moving her fingers. She read the accompanying instructions and has been working her fingers while she watches Jeopardy and other shows she can't miss. Mom tells me she can close her fingers to touch the heel of her hand again, and she can tell a huge difference in her grip strength. This is a simple product that delivers complex results.
customer_reviews.author: Nichols Notes

customer_reviews.title: Great for Grip Strength and Support Muscles
customer_reviews.text: I've loved using these grip strength eggs. I use them daily at work to combat carpel tunnel and arthritis. It's important to keep your joints flexible and to make sure to work all the small support muscles that you may not generally be able to strengthen.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Halbrooks

customer_reviews.title: ... old son for his occupational therapy exercises and I love it. Because each egg has a different color ...
customer_reviews.text: I use this product with my three year old son for his occupational therapy exercises and I love it. Because each egg has a different color and resistance we get to discuss what makes them unique while belonging to the same group. And we are exercising his little hands the whole time! This product is one of many essential stepping stones to my sons independence. Thank you Maureen, Jessie, Kendall, and Kate for having this fantastic product be so affordable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great little eggs!
customer_reviews.text: These were exactly what I was looking for! I noticed I've had some hand fatigue lately (I think due to a neck problem) so I wanted a product to help strengthen my hands. These seem to be good quality and the 3 different resistance levels are good (right now I'm starting with the soft one). It also comes with a little booklet with a few exercises in it. They seem to be a good size for my hands as well. I'm happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Rose

customer_reviews.title: Yay!!
customer_reviews.text: I've tried a dozen things. These things work better than a typical stress ball, the difference of give is apparent and they seem pretty awesome for the price. Would buy again and likely will. I can see long term these eventually ripping. But it's string enough that I can squeeze the yellow one all my strength and doesn't seem to hurt it.
customer_reviews.author: Tagban

customer_reviews.title: These really work
customer_reviews.text: I’m 70 years old and the strength in my hands aren’t what they used to be and a little arthritis has set in as well. These little wonder eggs are so good in helping strengthening my hands and fingers. The three different levels of hardness is great, I’m still on the softest but hope to be opening pickle jars again soon.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Ice

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Had a muscle/tendon injury near my elbow, and been using these for a week to gradually regain movement and strength. Quality and texture appears pretty good. Not slippery or tacky. I like that there are three per package with different amount of resistance. I imagine it can also act as a fidget toy.
customer_reviews.author: Zom

customer_reviews.title: So-so; depends on your preferences.
customer_reviews.text: My family prefers to have the easy-squish one of the three. I took the other. A bit small for my hand, and the egg shape is not any improvement over a sphere. Also family shared that they liked the balls with a cover better. Material is much better than liquid-filled fidget squishier though.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Hinton-Miller

customer_reviews.title: Very cool...and they work!
customer_reviews.text: Squishy, but good to hold. Comes with three different balls in three different levels of hardness, soft medium and a little harder than medium. Don’t want to say hard because it’s not golf ball hard...more like a tennis ball. Good for hand strength. I had carpal tunnel surgery on left hand and therapist recommended these to me. You won’t be disappointed, these are good.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Nelxon

customer_reviews.title: Eggcellent❣
customer_reviews.text: These are lovely to look at and delightful to hold. They are not sticky just have a very nice feeling tack to them. Exercising my hands has helped the arthritis pain immensely. I highly recommend these great little eggs.
customer_reviews.author: G. P. M.

customer_reviews.title: Graduated Eggs Help With Stiffness
customer_reviews.text: Soft, medium, and firm "eggs"... I got the smaller size, which seem great for my hands. My fingers, especially the pads at the ends, sometimes ache with such acute pain, and these help exercise my joints without eliciting so much pain. Slightly pebbled texture on the surface. They seem to be helping the stiffness I feel in my finger joints.
customer_reviews.author: Booklover

customer_reviews.title: Soft and Great Shape
customer_reviews.text: Excellent! Because I have small hands, these "eggs" work much better for my physical therapy exercises to restore a broken finger. In addition, I will continue using them for stress relief. Also pleased with the company and their checking in.
customer_reviews.author: maryknits

customer_reviews.title: They are made of a substance that is pleasant and easy to squeeze and yet provides enough resistance
customer_reviews.text: They are well made and while they don't lead to miraculous recovery from wrist / hand problems and don't necessarily resolve stress (although sure beat spinners in that regard)......They are made of a substance that is pleasant and easy to squeeze and yet provides enough resistance, too. A good product for what it is supposed to do.
customer_reviews.author: G&J

customer_reviews.title: Well Designed & Great Value
customer_reviews.text: These hand strengthen ovals sure work nicely. They come in 3 colors/tensions and fit the hand in a solid grip position. Great material; well made; and at the right price. The company is very responsive to customers and follows through to make sure you are satisfied with their product. Excellent service.
customer_reviews.author: NibbleNose

customer_reviews.title: Puts a squeeze on my anxiety! Lol
customer_reviews.text: I really like these! I purchased them to use as a distraction when my anxiety amps up. I think this is a really nice size because I can fit it in my scrub pocket and take it out to squeeze when I need to. So far I've used the softest ball which has a nice, firm 'squish'. The other two are also nice feeling. They're also very easy to clean; I just rinsed with water and gently dried it with a towel.
customer_reviews.author: Miss M

customer_reviews.title: Great for hand strengthening
customer_reviews.text: Love the feel and different firmness levels of these egg-shaped grip strengtheners. As I get older with symptoms of arthritis in my hands, these are really helping. My left hand sprains easy, so hoping this will strengthen the muscles to avert this. So far, so good!
customer_reviews.author: Rodger C. Niemeier

customer_reviews.title: Great after hand surgery!
customer_reviews.text: I found these when looking for other therapies after reconstructive hand surgery. Perfect size and shape with many different exercises, and the varying levels are perfect for progression. Plus, they are really fun. My occupational therapists enjoyed them too!
customer_reviews.author: Savvy/shopper

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for easing pain, helping flexibility with hand arthritis
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my husband, a golfer and ukulele player, who's been having some issues with finger/hand arthritis. The grip "eggs" (shape) have been quite helpful; he uses them throughout the day and evening when at rest, watching TV. etc. The gentle stretch eases pain, helps mobility. Great that there are 3 different firmness choices. The design is clean, simple, attractive. The packaging and service, impeccable. Thank you, Friendly Swede.
customer_reviews.author: NorCalReader

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for exercise tools to regain strength in my hand. These are the perfect size and fit well in the palm of my hand. I also like that there was a booklet for other suggested exercises aside from just squeezing. They are also a great size for travel. I also love that there are three different levels of resistance. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Protect your purchase!
customer_reviews.text: My hubby loves these things! Turns out, everyone else does too! He works in an office environment and took one to work. Coworkers gushed over it and before long it was missing. Silly hubby took another one to work and that one has also mysteriously vanished. He's now left with the dark one which he doesn't use as often. Humans can be so awful sometimes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Helped my injured hand.
customer_reviews.text: Good product. Used it to rehabilitate my hand that had been wounded when I broke up a cat fight. The only blood that was shed was mine! I developed an infection that injured a tendon on a finger. Using these therapy balls really helped it to regain its strength. I'm an RN, so healthy, strong hands are vital. These did the job.
customer_reviews.author: Grimmee Rawker.

customer_reviews.title: We love
customer_reviews.text: I really like these as stress balls, I bought them to take attention away from biting my nails at work and in my car and they’ve been effective thus far. Glad it came with three for my car, home, and work. They haven’t torn or ripped which I love. They can get a little dirty from use or if you drop them but easy to clean with running water or even just Clorox wipes. I’d buy these again if i needed more for some reason
customer_reviews.author: Amy Conner

customer_reviews.title: Each egg is a different level of hardness so you can switch once the soft one becomes too easy to squeeze
customer_reviews.text: I had carpal tunnel surgery and these eggs helped me regain my strength. Each egg is a different level of hardness so you can switch once the soft one becomes too easy to squeeze.
customer_reviews.author: Mitch

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for hand therapy
customer_reviews.text: I was bit by a cat on September 1. Have had to go to physical/ occupational therapy to regain full use of my hand. There are three balls in graduated strengths. I am on the middle one now. If you need hand exercises this set is the one to get.
customer_reviews.author: Dorothy

product_meta.title: The Friendly Swede Hand Grip Strength Trainer, Stress Ball for Adults and Kids, Hand Therapy Ball Squishy - Set of 3 Finger Resistance Exercise Squeezer
feature_bullets: STRESS RELIEVER & HAND GRIP STRENGTHENER: These colorful fidget balls in three levels of progression (20 lb - 30 lb - 40 lb resistance) help you focus, relieve stress and train hands, forearms and wrists. For children and adults.

FRIENDLY DESIGN: Egg shaped for a comfortable fit in your hands. Made of skin-safe thermoplastic rubber (TRP). Three size options - for anyone in the family! Extra Small: 2”x1.3” Small: 2.5" x 1.75" Large: 3.0" x 2.2". Less messy than Therapy Putty. Easy to clean from dust and dirt.

PERFECT FOR: Preventing tension, increasing limberness and alleviating joint pain. Great stress relief toys for adults and kids. Perfect occupational distraction for quitting smoking. Grip muscle training for beginner lifters.
EXERCISE GUIDE: Scroll down for hand grip exercise ideas! Always consult with your physician before beginning any physical exercise program for rehabilitation purposes.
💛 LIFETIME WARRANTY: The Friendly Swede offers a satisfaction guarantee that extends beyond Amazon’s return window. Contact us 7 days a week: http://amzn.to/1AmGlj8
